item.ptxt: Lack of power caused by abnormal fuel injection volume (fuel supply pump malfunction or injector malfunction)
Lack of power caused by intake air volume shortage (turbocharger malfunction, front exhaust pipe or exhaust manifold converter blocked)

Specified values in the following troubleshooting flowchart are for reference only. Variations in the Data List values may occur depending on the measuring conditions or the vehicle's age. Do not judge the vehicle to be normal even when the Data List values indicate a standard level. There are possibly some concealed factors of the malfunction.
Check that the vehicle has not been modified in any way prior to the vehicle inspection.
This troubleshooting procedure checks for the cause of an obvious lack of engine power (the vehicle speed does not reach the target speed in the high speed range) while the vehicle is being driven.
After replacing the fuel supply pump, the ECM needs initialization (See page ).
After replacing the injector, the ECM needs registration (See page ).
Check the fuel system for blockages.
Check the engine idling speed and the maximum engine speed.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK WIRE HARNESS AND CONNECTOR IN ENGINE ROOM

test1.ptxt: Check the wire harness and connector connections of common rail system components.

specitem.ptxt: The wire harnesses and connectors are connected securely.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE HARNESS OR CONNECTOR

atten4.ptxt: Drive the vehicle according to the driving pattern below to allow the ECM to set DTCs relating to malfunctions of the fuel system, EGR system, and throttle valve. If DTCs are set, problem areas can be identified.

test1.ptxt: Enter Check Mode.
Click here
Fully warm up the engine.
Allow the engine to idle for 5 minutes or more.
Drive the vehicle at more than 40 km/h (25 mph) for 1 minute or more (procedure "A").
Decelerate and stop the vehicle (procedure "B").
Repeat procedure "A" and procedure "B" 4 times or more.
Stop the engine and wait for at least 10 seconds (procedure "C").
Repeat procedure "A" and procedure "C" described above to set DTCs relating to the EGR system and throttle valve.
Drive the vehicle at more than 70 km/h (43 mph) for at least 1 minute (to set DTCs relating to the fuel supply pump).
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

test1.ptxt: Read DTCs.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (TEST THE FUEL LEAK)

atten4.ptxt: By performing this Active Test, the engine speed is maintained at 2000 rpm and the common rail internal fuel pressure is raised to the maximum operating pressure. As a result, a fuel leak check can be conducted while retaining the high common rail pressure.

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Test the Fuel Leak.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

test1.ptxt: Visually check the fuel supply pump, injector, and fuel line located between the fuel supply pump and common rail for fuel leaks and fuel pressure leaks. Also, perform the same check on the fuel line between the common rail and the injector.

atten4.ptxt: There may be fuel leaks inside the components, such as the fuel supply pump.

action.actiontitle: REPAIR OR REPLACE FUEL LEAKAGE POINT

test1.ptxt: From an idling state, accelerate the engine to 3000 rpm several times and check that white smoke is not emitted from the exhaust pipe. Also, check that the intake system pipes and hoses are not excessively contaminated with oil.

atten4.ptxt: If white smoke is emitted from the intake system, its pipes and hoses are excessively contaminated with oil. If the presence of white smoke in the exhaust gas is confirmed, there is a high possibility of mechanical problems in the turbocharger or engine.

entry.ptxt: White smoke emitted, and intake system pipes and hoses excessively contaminated with oil

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (MAP, MAF, FUEL PRESS)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

entry.ptxt: Intake manifold internal pressure detected by manifold absolute pressure sensor
Intake air volume detected by mass air flow meter

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF with a fully warm engine.

action.actiontitle: GO TO DTC P0105, P0107 AND P0108 (RELATED TO MANIFOLD ABSOLUTE PRESSURE SENSOR)
GO TO DTC P0100, P0102 AND P0103 (RELATED TO MASS AIR FLOW METER)

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine, warm it up and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

entry.ptxt: Value of injector fuel injection volume compensates for differences in combustion condition of cylinders

item.ptxt: Positive values indicate control which corrects combustion degradation
Negative values indicate control which corrects excessive combustion pressure
If problems exist, "Injection Feedback Val"may deviate from the -3.0 and 3.0 mm3 range

entry.ptxt: Fuel injection volume value controlled by ECU

item.ptxt: Controls NE signal, fuel temperature, engine coolant temperature, intake air temperature, boost pressure, atmospheric pressure, EGR volume, and MAF
If problems exist, "Injection Volume" may be outside the standard range

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF with a fully warm engine.

entry.ptxt: Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 and/or Injection Volume outside standard range

test1.ptxt: Read the injector compensation code.
Click here

atten4.ptxt: If the injector compensation code is not correctly registered, it may cause malfunctions.

test1.ptxt: Check the injector compensation code.

specitem.ptxt: Compensation code of the installed injector is the same as the code registered in the ECM.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal for at least 2 minutes.
Reconnect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Check whether the malfunction has been successfully repaired by performing a driving test using the freeze frame data recorded at the time the malfunction occurred.
To bleed air from the priming pump, pump the priming pump until it becomes hard and cannot be pumped any more.

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Check whether the lack of power has been successfully repaired by performing a driving test. Use the freeze frame data recorded at the time the malfunction occurred.
Follow the instructions in the table below according to the check result of the GTS.

atten4.ptxt: This operation is based on the premise that the common rail pressure is normal.
*: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF, and the engine should be fully warmed up.

entry.ptxt: 3.0 mm3/st or more, -3.0 mm3/st or less

atten4.ptxt: *: When the Injection Volume displayed on the tester is large despite the Fuel Press and Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 in the Data List being normal, the injector may be clogged. In this case, there may be deposits inside or outside the tip of the injector.

entry.ptxt: Inspect and repair cylinder injector withrevised injection volume of less than 3.0 mm3/st:

item.ptxt: Perform power balance inspection and identify malfunctioning cylinder

entry.ptxt: Abnormal value cylinder injector injects excessively large quantity of fuel
Identify malfunctioning cylinders by conducting power balance inspection:

item.ptxt: Perform power balance inspection to identify malfunctioning cylinders
Clean malfunctioning cylinder injector, then check and repair it

entry.ptxt: Abnormal value cylinder injector injects excessively large quantity of fuel

item.ptxt: Fuel injection volume too low due to injector nozzle being blocked by deposits
Abnormal value cylinder injector compression decreases
Abnormal value cylinder injector injects excessively large quantity of fuel

entry.ptxt: Inspect and repair all cylinder injectors:
Clean all cylinder injectors, and then inspect and repair them
All cylinder injectors inject excessively small quantity of fuel:
Fuel injection volume too low due to all cylinder injector nozzles being blocked by deposits

item.ptxt: Despite the injector functioning normally, the indicated Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 value may be outside the normal operating range due to compensation for other problems (such as low compression).

Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 is the value used to correct the fuel injection volumes of each cylinder, in order to optimize (compensate for the unevenness between) all the cylinder combustion conditions. If any of the cylinders malfunction, the fuel injection volumes for the normal cylinders are corrected simultaneously. As a result, the Injection Feedback Val #1 to #8 may deviate from the standard range.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (FUEL CUT FOR IDENTIFYING MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

test1.ptxt: Check the 8 cylinders in sequence to identify any faulty cylinders by performing the power balance inspection.

item.ptxt: If the engine idle speed does not change when an injector is disabled, the cylinder being tested is malfunctioning.
If the cylinder being tested is normal, there will be a significant change in idle speed when the fuel injection is stopped for that cylinder.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the glow plug wire.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

atten4.ptxt: If any of the glow plugs has an open circuit, the engine power will be insufficient only when the engine is cold.

item.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the glow plug pipes. Damaging them could cause an open circuit, or shorten the life of the glow plugs.
Keep the glow plugs free of oil and fuel while cleaning.
Wipe any oil off of the terminal and Bakelite washer with a clean, dry cloth during inspection.
Do not apply more than 11 V to the glow plugs as it may cause an open circuit.

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the glow plug wire.
Inspect the clutch pedal switch.
Click here
Disconnect the C78 shift position sensor.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Check the fuel quality.
Check the fuel for air.
Check the fuel system for blockages.
Check the air filter.
Check the engine oil.
Check the engine coolant.
Check the engine idling speed and the maximum engine speed.
Check the vacuum pump.
Check for air leakage and blockage between the air cleaner and turbocharger, and between the turbocharger and intake manifold.

testgrp.testtitle: PERFORM ACTIVE TEST USING GTS (FUEL CUT FOR IDENTIFYING MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Active Test

data-name.name: item-name
data-name.ptxt: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

app-param-unit.app-param: Control the Select Cylinder Fuel Cut

test1.ptxt: Check the 8 cylinders in sequence to identify any faulty cylinders by performing the power balance inspection.

item.ptxt: If the engine idle speed does not change when an injector is disabled, the cylinder being tested is malfunctioning.
If the cylinder being tested is normal, there will be a significant change in idle speed when the fuel injection is stopped for that cylinder.

test1.ptxt: Check the cylinder compression pressure.
Click here

action.actiontitle: CHECK ENGINE TO DETERMINE CAUSE OF LOW COMPRESSION

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK MALFUNCTIONING CYLINDER'S INJECTOR FOR DEPOSITS

atten4.ptxt: If an injector is contaminated with deposits, the fuel injection volume deviates from the standard range. This may cause malfunctions.

test1.ptxt: Check the injector for any deposits.
Wipe away deposits from the tips of the injectors.

atten4.ptxt: Solvent or carbon removal agents help remove the deposits easily.

atten3.ptxt: Exercise extreme care not to damage the injectors while wiping off the deposits.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Reinstall the injector to the cylinder head.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

item.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF, and the engine should be fully warmed up.
When the values are outside the standard range, deposits inside the injector may be causing the problem.

specitem.ptxt: Values are within the standard range.

atten4.ptxt: If an injector is contaminated with deposits, the fuel injection volume deviates from the standard range. This may cause malfunctions.

test1.ptxt: Check the injector for any deposits.
Wipe away deposits from the tips of the injectors.

atten4.ptxt: Solvent or carbon removal agents help remove the deposits easily.

atten3.ptxt: Exercise extreme care not to damage the injectors while wiping off the deposits.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (INJECTION FEEDBACK VAL AND INJECTION VOLUME)

test1.ptxt: Reinstall the injector to the cylinder head.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine and warm it up.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

item.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF, and the engine should be fully warmed up.
When the values are outside the standard range, deposits inside the injector may be causing the problem.

specitem.ptxt: Values are within the standard range.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK EGR VALVE ASSEMBLY (NO. 1 AND NO. 2)

atten4.ptxt: In this inspection, measure the MAF rate while idling the engine with the EGR valve fully closed.

test1.ptxt: Make sure the engine is stopped.
Disconnect the EGR valve connector.
Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Start the engine.
Enter the following menu items: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / MAF.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Measure the MAF rate while idling the engine.

specitem.ptxt: MAF rate is between 14.2 and 26.5 gm/sec.

item.ptxt: Standard MAF rate while idling the engine with the EGR valve operating: 6.1 to 26.5 gm/sec.
With the EGR valve connector disconnected, a DTC is set when the ignition switch is turned to ON. Therefore, clear the DTC upon completion of the inspection above.

testgrp.testtitle: READ VALUE USING GTS (ACTUAL THROTTLE POSITION)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Actual Throttle Position and Actual Throttle Position #2.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Read the value.

action.actiontitle: REPLACE DIESEL THROTTLE BODY ASSEMBLY (for Bank 1 or for Bank 2)

test1.ptxt: Check for air leakage and blockage between the air cleaner and turbocharger, and between the turbocharger and intake manifold.
Disconnect the air cleaner hose.
Use a mirror to visually check the turbocharger for any mechanical problems.
When the engine is cold, check that the impeller of the turbocharger rotates smoothly, and perform a contact check to confirm if it is damaged.

specitem.ptxt: Impeller rotates smoothly and is not damaged.

test1.ptxt: Reconnect the air cleaner hose.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK VACUUM HOSE (TURBOCHARGER - VRV, VRV - VACUUM PUMP)

test1.ptxt: Check that the vacuum hoses are installed correctly, do not have any cracks or damage, and do not have any air leaks or blockage.

specitem.ptxt: The vacuum hoses are correctly connected.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C91 Vacuum Regulating Valve (VRV) connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.
Inspect turbocharger actuator.
Click here

testgrp.testtitle: CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

entry.ptxt: Intake manifold internal pressure detected by manifold absolute pressure sensor
Intake air volume detected by mass air flow meter

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF with a fully warm engine.

specitem.ptxt: The values are within the standard range.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK AND REPLACE FUEL FILTER ASSEMBLY
CONFIRM WHETHER MALFUNCTION HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY REPAIRED

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Start the engine and warm it up, and turn the GTS on.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Data List

test1.ptxt: Enter the following menus in order and read the values.

atten4.ptxt: *: The A/C switch and all accessory switches should be OFF, and the engine should be fully warmed up.

specitem.ptxt: The values are within the standard range.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT COMMON RAIL RH (FUEL PRESSURE SENSOR)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the C56 fuel pressure sensor connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT FUEL SUPPLY PUMP (SUCTION CONTROL VALVE)

test1.ptxt: Disconnect the rC1 fuel temperature sensor, suction control valve connector.
Measure the resistance according to the value(s) in the table below.

action.actiontitle: CHECK AND REPLACE COMMON RAIL LH (FUEL LIMITER)
